headline: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) Reports Lower Q1 Earnings With Net Income of US$471 Million
summary: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) recently reported a decrease in revenue and net income for the first quarter of 2025, reflecting financial challenges. Despite these declines, the company declared a regular dividend and strategically adjusted its credit agreements, aiming to shore up its financial flexibility. In the broader market context, shares of Ford rose by 6% over the last month, a move generally aligned with the upward trend seen across the market, which gained 8% over 12 months. Ford's dividend...

headline: Ford Suspended Its Earnings Guidance. Why the Stock Is Rising.
summary: Ford Motor  reported far better-than-expected first-quarter results but sees a steep hit to profits for the full year and has suspended its financial guidance.  “Our fundamental business is improving,” said Sherry House, chief financial officer, during a call with reporters.  Ford stock opened in the red but recovered.

raw.headline: Ford Suspended Its Earnings Guidance. Why the Stock Is Rising.
raw.summary: Ford Motor  reported far better-than-expected first-quarter results but sees a steep hit to profits for the full year and has suspended its financial guidance.  “Our fundamental business is improving,” said Sherry House, chief financial officer, during a call with reporters.  Ford stock opened in the red but recovered.

headline: Ford CEO Expects Tariffs to Stick Around for Years
summary: Ford Motor Chief Executive Jim Farley expects President Trump’s tariffs on foreign vehicles and automotive parts to be in place “at least for the next three years.”  Farley suggested some of Ford’s most affordable U.S. vehicles—the Bronco Sport SUV and Maverick compact pickup—would cost more if they were assembled in the U.S. instead of Mexico.  Farley said it was “easy to see” tariffs will lead to industrywide price increases as soon as the summer, given about half the vehicles sold in the U.S. are imported and will be stuck with “$5,000 or more of tariffs” by then.

raw.headline: Ford CEO Expects Tariffs to Stick Around for Years
raw.summary: Ford Motor Chief Executive Jim Farley expects President Trump’s tariffs on foreign vehicles and automotive parts to be in place “at least for the next three years.”  Farley suggested some of Ford’s most affordable U.S. vehicles—the Bronco Sport SUV and Maverick compact pickup—would cost more if they were assembled in the U.S. instead of Mexico.  Farley said it was “easy to see” tariffs will lead to industrywide price increases as soon as the summer, given about half the vehicles sold in the U.S. are imported and will be stuck with “$5,000 or more of tariffs” by then.

headline: Ford faces double whammy of tariffs, 'poor management': Analyst
summary: While topping earnings and revenue estimates for its first quarter, US automaker Ford (F) expects President Trump's tariffs to weigh down its net profits by $1.5 billion. The Trump administration's latest tariffs on foreign-made auto parts went into effect on May 3, allowing partial exemptions for American auto companies. CFRA Analyst Garrett Nelson comes on The Morning Brief to talk about Ford's suspended full-year guidance, the company's performance nearly five years into Jim Farley's tenure as CEO, and its vehicle pricing. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Ford warns on tariffs, Palantir slides, Fed meeting: 3 Things
summary: Following its latest earnings beat, US automaker Ford (F) warned of the trade war impacts that President Trump's could have on the company and the broader auto industry. Palantir Technologies (PLTR) topped first quarter revenue estimates after reporting results on Monday. The company's shares are falling in Tuesday's pre-market trading. Federal Reserve officials are convening in Washington, D.C. for their May FOMC meeting starting today and concluding on Wednesday, May 7, with the latest decision on interest rates and a press conference with Chair Jerome Powell. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
